name: Mitigation Playbook for PowerShell Malware Incident
description: This playbook addresses an incident where PowerShell was exploited to execute a malicious script on a corporate server. Immediate actions involve killing the malicious process, removing dropped files, and alerting the security team.

action--f1e86c6e-3dd7-4d88-92b3-3b7bccd6.name: Kill malicious process
action--f1e86c6e-3dd7-4d88-92b3-3b7bccd6.description: Terminate any running PowerShell processes related to the malicious activity.

if-condition--7e5b3c8e-970b-4cb8-b900-69.name: Check if malicious process was found

loop--6a4f6089-1c44-4f69-b90b-250fb4f06c.name: Remove dropped files
loop--6a4f6089-1c44-4f69-b90b-250fb4f06c.description: Continue to remove any dropped malicious files until none are found.

action--6a4f6089-1c44-4f69-b90b-250fb4f0.name: Delete malicious payload files
action--6a4f6089-1c44-4f69-b90b-250fb4f0.description: Remove malicious payload files from the system.

action--84f0327e-3c17-4b69-af83-8a1d976c.name: Alert security team
action--84f0327e-3c17-4b69-af83-8a1d976c.description: Notify the security team about the detected malicious activity.

commands.command: echo 'Malicious activity detected on host-15' | mail -s 'Incident Alert' security@company.com

malicious_process_found.description: Indicates if a malicious process was found on the host.

dropped_files_found.description: Indicates if any malicious files have been dropped on the server.
